etymology.description: Depicts an altar -> additional strokes added to distinguish from unrelated characters
etymology.interpretation: Originally, 示(示) (shì, "to show/divine") depicted an altar, hinting at its usage in rites and ceremonies. Additional strokes differentiated it from similar ancient characters.

examples.chinese: 老师示范操作(老師示範操作)，让同学更易理解(讓同學更易理解)。
examples.pinyin: lǎo shī shì fàn cāo zuò, ràng tóng xué gèng yì lǐ jiě。
examples.english: The teacher demonstrates the operation, making it easier for students to understand.

examples.chinese: 祭司示天意(祭司示天意)，点燃希望之火(點燃希望之火)。
examples.pinyin: jì sì shì tiān yì, diǎn rán xī wàng zhī huǒ。
examples.english: The priest divines the will of heaven, igniting the flame of hope.

examples.chinese: 古人以卜示未来(古人以卜示未來)。
examples.pinyin: gǔ rén yǐ bǔ shì wèi lái。
examples.english: Ancient people used divination to foretell the future.
